title.narrative: F.a: Decent Work and Union Building

description.narrative: The project supports recruitment of around 3 000 new members to the Mozambican unions organizing in forestry sector, encouragement of members to be active in the unions by establishing 30 study circles focusing on basic union action and by training 50 trai ners who in turn train a couple of hundred shop stewards, OHS representatives and other active members in basic rights and health and safety. Additionally union leaders expand their knowhow by familiarizing themselves with other countries’ experiences ab out servicing members, negotiations and advocacy work. This way the capacity of the unions to act in an environment increasingly dominated by MNCs grows and they are able to effectively defend the interests of the members and influence industrial policies. As a result of the project the unions grow both in quantity and quality and become more relevant stakeholders in the development of the forestry sector. Beneficiaries are members of the implementing unions, shop stewards, OHS representatives, union leader ship and ultimately forestry sector workers through improved working conditions. Two unions representing agriculture + forestry workers and chemical + paper industry are the implementing partners.
